channel.title: 259 inspired polyphonic synthesizer
channel.description: It all started when I've decided to create a synthesizer based on a Buchla Programable Complex Waveform Generator 259. It wasn't supposed to be a clone or a software emulation, just based around the concept of it's architecture and something different than all the subtractive synthesizers I've done so far. Long story short after few trials and errors I've decided to go with a simpler architecture, leaving some functions behind. So it's two sine oscillators (with waveshapers), secondary osc is modulating the phase and/or amplitude of the primary osc, two ADSR envelope generators - one for each of the oscillators vcas. Secondary osc can be detuned and hard sync'ed to primary. 4-voice polyphony. :slight_smile: https://soundcloud.com/odro/axoloti-pm-synth (Raw audio from the Axoloti audio out, there are no effects in the patch, just two long envelopes.) All parameters can be controlled with knobs on Axocontrol, similarly like I did it with my [previous synthesizer](http://community.axoloti.com/t/simple-synthesizer-for-axocontrol/1928)

item.title: 259 inspired polyphonic synthesizer
item.dc:creator: @maceq687 Maciek
item.description:
@maceq687 wrote:

I've just did. My complex poly synth rebuild for Axoctrl is now on github: Axoctrl_Complex_Poly_V1.6.rar
I've also renamed previous patches designed for AxoControl and Axoctrl so that they could be easier to distinguish.

Patch details:
Voice count: 3 (75% DSP used). Modulation depth is linked to mod wheel

Page 1 [OSCILLATORS]:

  • Knob 10 - [2slew] - modulation oscillator slew
  • Knob 11 - [2oct] - modulation oscillator octave (+/-4 in relation to primary osc)
  • Knob 12 - [2fold] - modulation oscillator wavefold (sine - fold 100%)
  • Knob 13 - [1shp] - primary oscillator shape (full ccw - saturated (square), middle sine, full cw - wavefold 100%)

Page 2 [MOD_ENV]:

  • Knob 10 - [MODa] - modulation envelope attack time (2,41ms - 3,91s)
  • Knob 11 - [MODd] - modulation envelope decay time (2,41ms - 3,91s)
  • Knob 12 - [MODs] - modulation envelope sustain level (0-100%)
  • Knob 13 - [MODr] - modulation envelope release time (2,41ms - 3,91s)

Page 3 [AMP_ENV]:

  • Knob 10 - [AMPa] - modulation envelope attack time (2,41ms - 3,91s)
  • Knob 11 - [AMPd] - modulation envelope decay time (2,41ms - 3,91s)
  • Knob 12 - [AMPs] - modulation envelope sustain level (0-100%)
  • Knob 13 - [AMPr] - modulation envelope release time (2,41ms - 3,91s)

Button 4 - decrease page number
Button 5 - increase page number
Button 6 - short press toggles display modes - parameters or oscilloscope
Button 6 - long press toggles modulation envelope control over primary oscillator wavefold depth (LED 2)
Button 7 - toggles hard sync of modulation oscillator to primary oscillator (LED 3)
Knob 9 - master volume
Knob 14 - modulation oscillator tune (+/-7 semitones)
Knob 15 - modulation depth (same control as mod wheel)
LED 1 - indicates if either voice gate is high

It's mostly recreation of what was available in the AxoControl version. I've dropped the option of pitch bend for the secondary oscillator - AxoControl had spring loaded joystick that was used for that. I'm planning to assign MIDI pitch bend to control secondary oscillator pitch bending instead. Knob 8 and 16 are unassigned so far and it is possible to create more pages to control even more parameters. Amplitude modulation did not get any opportunity to shine yet.

Read full topic

item.title: 259 inspired polyphonic synthesizer
item.dc:creator: @Pastitas
item.description:
@Pastitas wrote:

So how did you do the config pages anyway, did you edit the Hohum default patches or make your own from scratch? honestly, for me it's starting to look like i'd rather code my own, because 12% base use just for changing patches, osc in screen and 5 pots = the lfo thing that i don't need feels like too much of a sacrifice, since i am interested in MPE patches mainly i'd like to keep the "base" as tiny as possible

Read full topic
